commit_message:
[spec] New Tasks Configuration section - hook

This document describes new section in task config.
This changes needed for reliability and density testing
of OpenStack clusters.

Change-Id: I39fed4b820710b74cf902363dd1c683622f89ca7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/48/350748/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ====================================== New Tasks Configuration section - hook ====================================== Problem description =================== Rally lacks of plugin type that would run some code on specified iteration. New plugin type is required for reliability testing of OpenStack. This type of plugin would give an ability to activate factors on some iteration and provide timestamps and some info about executed actions to rally report. Proposed change =============== Add a new section to task config: Schema of hook section allows to specify number of iteration and a list of hook plugins that should be executed on this iteration. .. code:: json { "KeystoneBasic.create_delete_user": [ { "args": {}, "runner": { "type": "constant", "times": 100, "concurrency": 10 }, "hook": { # new section "iterations": { "20": [ # iteration number { "example_hook": { "cmd": "bash enable_factor_1" } }, { "example_hook": { "cmd": "bash enable_factor_2" } } ], "40": [ # iteration number { "example_hook": { "cmd": "bash disable_factor_1" } }, { "example_hook": { "cmd": "bash disable_factor_2" } } ] } } } ] } Add a new base class for such plugins, that should: - contain common logic for schema validation - provide abstract method 'run' which should be implemented in plugins this method should be called before specified iteration has been executed Hook plugin classes should: - Implement 'run' method which returns dict with result of action: .. code:: json { "action_name": "my_action", "status": "success" } Add HookExecuter class to run hook plugins, that should: - controll when to run a hook specified in config - save timestamps when hook method started - save duration of execution of hook method - recieve result of hook execution from hook plugin - return a full result of hook execution in the following format: .. code:: json { "started_at": datetime.datetime(), "finished_at": datetime.datetime(), "hook_name": "example_hook", "action_name": "my action", "status": "success", } Modify ResultConsumer, that should: - controll HookExecuter and provide info about iterations - add a full result to TaskResult Example code of base class: .. code:: python @plugin.base() @six.add_metaclass(abc.ABCMeta) class Hook(plugin.Plugin): @staticmethod def validate(config): # schema validation pass def __init__(self, criterion_value): self.criterion_value = criterion_value @abc.abstractmethod def run(self): pass example_hook class: .. code:: python @hook.configure(name="example_hook") class ExampleHook(hook.Hook): CONFIG_SCHEMA = { "type": "object", "$schema": consts.JSON_SCHEMA, "properties": { "cmd": { "type": "string" }, "required": [ "cmd", ], "additionalProperties": False, } def __init__(self, criterion_value): super(ExampleHook, self).__init__(criterion_value) self.cmd = self.criterion_value["cmd"] def run(self): # do some action rc = os.system(self.cmd) return { "action_name": "my action", "status": "success", } example of hook result that goes to TaskResult: .. code:: python [ ( 20, { "hook_name": "example_hook", "started": datetime.datetime(), "duration": datetime.timedelta(), "action_name": "my action", "status": "success", } ), ( 40, { "hook_name": "example_hook", "started": datetime.datetime(), "duration": datetime.timedelta(), "action_name": "my action", "status": "success", } ) ] Alternatives ------------ Use sla section for such plugins, but this looks weird Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: - astudenov <astudenov@mirantis.com> - ylobankov <ylobankov@mirantis.com> Work Items ---------- - Implement new section in task config - Add example hook Dependencies ============ None

commit_message:
Fix the memcache location value in horizon local settings

When setting multi memcached servers, the value should be a list
rather then a comma joined string

This patch set I586ce1c6c3300254c4e2a398ff46645df576aeb0 set it in
wrong

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ic612658ab0310c6764310bbca92c925da6d47f6c

deleted_lines: Generate the leaf certificate request and key that will be used for the public VIP:: openssl req -newkey rsa:2048 -days 365 \ -nodes -keyout server-key.pem -out server-req.pem Process the server RSA key:: openssl rsa -in server-key.pem -out server-key.pem Sign the leaf certificate with the CA certificate and generate the certificate:: openssl x509 -req -in server-req.pem -days 365 \ -CA overcloud-cacert.pem -CAkey overcloud-ca-privkey.pem \ -set_serial 01 -out server-cert.pem

commit_message:
Created Version Class

The version class allows us to parse, and compare, API version strings
as per the OpenStack API WG Microversion Specification. Several formats
are supported:

* v#.#.# (legacy)
* #.#.# (legacy)
* [service name] #.#.#

In the former two cases, a service type will have to be manually supplied
to ensure proper comparison.

https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/microversion_specification.html

Change-Id: If3596418dfe2e76489bdb48d4d15f7f3e7a6d2f9

added_lines: /* * Copyright (c) 2016 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development L.P. * * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not * use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy * of the License at * * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 * * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT * WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. * * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and * limitations under the License. */ import Version from '../../../src/util/version.js'; describe('Version', () => { it("should parse various header versions", () => { const testVersion = function (args, results) { const v = new Version(...args); expect(v.service).toBe(results[0]); expect(v.major).toBe(results[1]); expect(v.minor).toBe(results[2]); expect(v.patch).toBe(results[3]); }; testVersion(['identity 1.2'], ['identity', 1, 2, 0]); testVersion(['identity 0.2'], ['identity', 0, 2, 0]); testVersion(['compute 2222222.09'], ['compute', 2222222, 9, 0]); testVersion(['compute 03.09'], ['compute', 3, 9, 0]); testVersion(['compute 03.0'], ['compute', 3, 0, 0]); testVersion(['compute 1'], ['compute', 1, 0, 0]); testVersion(['compute 0'], ['compute', 0, 0, 0]); testVersion(['v2.1.1'], [null, 2, 1, 1]); testVersion(['v2.1'], [null, 2, 1, 0]); testVersion(['v2'], [null, 2, 0, 0]); testVersion(['v'], [null, 0, 0, 0]); testVersion(['v0.2'], [null, 0, 2, 0]); testVersion(['2.1.1'], [null, 2, 1, 1]); testVersion(['2.1'], [null, 2, 1, 0]); testVersion(['2'], [null, 2, 0, 0]); testVersion([''], [null, 0, 0, 0]); testVersion(['0.2'], [null, 0, 2, 0]); testVersion(['compute', 'v2.1.1'], ['compute', 2, 1, 1]); testVersion(['compute', 'v2.1'], ['compute', 2, 1, 0]); testVersion(['compute', 'v2'], ['compute', 2, 0, 0]); testVersion(['compute', 'v'], ['compute', 0, 0, 0]); testVersion(['compute', 'v0.2'], ['compute', 0, 2, 0]); testVersion(['compute', '2.1.1'], ['compute', 2, 1, 1]); testVersion(['compute', '2.1'], ['compute', 2, 1, 0]); testVersion(['compute', '2'], ['compute', 2, 0, 0]); testVersion(['compute', ''], ['compute', 0, 0, 0]); testVersion(['compute', '0.2'], ['compute', 0, 2, 0]); // Invalid inputs... testVersion([null, null], [null, 0, 0, 0]); testVersion([{}, {}], [null, 0, 0, 0]); testVersion([null, {}], [null, 0, 0, 0]); testVersion([{}, null], [null, 0, 0, 0]); }); it("should test for correct equality", () => { const v1 = new Version("compute", "1.0.0"); // String tests... expect(v1.equals("compute 1.0.0")).toBe(true); expect(v1.equals("compute 1.0.1")).toBe(false); expect(v1.equals("identity 1.0.0")).toBe(false); // Version tests expect(v1.equals(new Version("compute 1.0.0"))).toBe(true); expect(v1.equals(new Version("compute 1.0.1"))).toBe(false); expect(v1.equals(new Version("identity 1.0.0"))).toBe(false); expect(v1.equals(new Version("1.0.0"))).toBe(false); const v2 = new Version("1.0.0"); // String tests... expect(v2.equals("compute 1.0.0")).toBe(false); expect(v2.equals("compute 1.0.1")).toBe(false); expect(v2.equals("1.0.0")).toBe(true); // Version tests expect(v2.equals(new Version("compute 1.0.0"))).toBe(false); expect(v2.equals(new Version("compute 1.0.1"))).toBe(false); expect(v2.equals(new Version("identity 1.0.0"))).toBe(false); expect(v2.equals(new Version("1.0.0"))).toBe(true); }); });

commit_message:
Update Ironic composable services

* Add service for configuring Nova compute with Ironic
* Fix authentication in Ironic APU
* Provide a separate environment file for enabling Ironic

Change-Id: I211e6d91eacd238b04a1aa37528d5a91523407d9
Partially-Implements: blueprint ironic-integration
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/33/341433/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: heat_template_version: 2016-04-08 description: > OpenStack Nova Compute service configured with Puppet and using Ironic parameters: EndpointMap: default: {} description: Mapping of service endpoint -> protocol. Typically set via parameter_defaults in the resource registry. type: json IronicPassword: description: The password for the Ironic service and db account, used by the Ironic services type: string hidden: true resources: NovaBase: type: ./nova-base.yaml outputs: role_data: description: Role data for the Nova Compute service with Ironic. value: config_settings: map_merge: - get_attr: [NovaBase, role_data, config_settings] - tripleo::profile::base::nova::manage_migration: true tripleo::profile::base::nova::nova_compute_enabled: true nova::compute::compute_manager: 'ironic.nova.compute.manager.ClusteredComputeManager' nova::compute::force_config_drive: true nova::compute::ironic::admin_username: 'ironic' nova::compute::ironic::admin_password: {get_param: IronicPassword} nova::compute::ironic::admin_url: {get_param: [EndpointMap, KeystoneAdmin, uri]} nova::compute::ironic::api_endpoint: {get_param: [EndpointMap, IronicInternal, uri]} nova::compute::reserved_host_memory: '0' nova::compute::vnc_enabled: false nova::network::neutron::dhcp_domain: '' nova::scheduler::filter::scheduler_host_manager: 'ironic_host_manager' step_config: | include tripleo::profile::base::nova::compute::ironic

Expand templated bash to allow for doc generation

Adding necessary template modifications to allow for
automated documentation generation from tripleo-collect
-logs[1]

[1] - https://review.gerrithub.io/#/c/286349/

commit_message:
[plugin] Change versioning scheme for plugins flow

   - Use `.dev` instead of `+dev` in version string because of pbr
     failures
   - Use `git archive` for pristine tarball generation

Change-Id: I437ee18b03c39483c4ed325e49846513d9443917

commit_message:
Fix orchestration service initialization

The orchestration service (heat) requires a project_id in its service
endpoint. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I67c273cc10b5281d40cbf2218060b86d543b3f2e

commit_message:
OS Upgrade tests: separate helpers

1. test_os_upgrade is moved under test_os_upgrade
2. main code is moved to separate place for excluding copy-paste
  in new tests.
3. Fixed logging due to unreadable output
4. Switch to check_call -> remove pain of cherry-picking
5. Use octane-cleanup

Closes-bug: #1612236
Change-Id: Ida7f5901f070a9ef507ce6027fd2618b8617d89f
(cherry picked from commit a9f7dd2)

commit_message:
Fix Neutron bootstrap failure due to missing fixtures dependency

Something changed in Neutron recently leading to a run time bootstrap
failure, visible in recent gate jobs [0]

http://logs.openstack.org/05/354405/1/check/gate-kolla-dsvm-deploy-centos-source-centos-7-nv/091f743/console.html#_2016-08-14_06_11_11_378967

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ic0d2ce1f0ef48cb2cb35e3281c4e8e9f5e98c15f

commit_message:
OS Upgrade tests: separate helpers

1. test_os_upgrade is moved under test_os_upgrade
2. main code is moved to separate place for excluding copy-paste
  in new tests.
3. Fixed logging due to unreadable output
4. Switch to check_call -> remove pain of cherry-picking
5. Use octane-cleanup

commit_message:
Make SSHManager._get_remote method 'trusted'

Backport minor changes in SSHManager class from
master branch - change _get_remote method signature
to get_remote trusted one.
This makes the method 'publickly' available. And in
turn allows accessing SSHClient.execute_through_host
method explicitly.

Change-Id: Ifa4ebe6b6a043342296c35fa7b77811f28376d9f

commit_message:
Don't register state_path opt on config import

As far as I know state_path is currently used only in
keepalived-state-change script so there is no reason to register cli_opt
for all components using common config.

Part of this patch also moves state_path option for config files to
core_opts.

Change-Id: Ic207b60f5cae955adba52f2b1ee0b86fdc93ca38
Closes-Bug: 1593245
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/71/330571/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Revert "Fix disk space calculation for custom backup locations"

This reverts commit e7d0ab4f8b47bf4bb194836e3f147c609638b8dc.

minimal backup/restore broke the postgres database

Change-Id: Id751b276e45785697921d86753598fd93780778a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/85/338185/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mkdir -p $SYSTEM_DIRS $backup_dir echo "Unrecognized backup destination. Valid options include:" 1>&2 fullbackup=1 if [[ "$2" != "$fullbackup" ]]; then spaceerror="Insufficient disk space to perform $1. At least 2gb must be free on ${BACKUP_ROOT} partition." spaceerror="Insufficient disk space to perform $1. At least 11gb must be free on ${BACKUP_ROOT} partition." avail=$(df --output=avail ${BACKUP_ROOT} | tail -1)
deleted_lines: mkdir -p $SYSTEM_DIRS $BACKUP_ROOT $backup_dir echo "Unrecognized backup destination or path does not exist. Valid options include:" 1>&2 if [[ -z "$backup_dir" || "$use_sync" == "1" ]]; then local backup_dir=$BACKUP_ROOT fi if [[ "$2" != 1 ]]; then spaceerror="Insufficient disk space to perform $1. At least 2gb must be free on ${backup_dir} partition." spaceerror="Insufficient disk space to perform $1. At least 11gb must be free on ${backup_dir} partition." avail=$(df --output=avail ${backup_dir} | tail -1)

commit_message:
Add discovery and build for multiple CPU architectures

This adds support for discovery of repo build servers for multiple
CPU architectures. When multiple architectures are detected among the
repo servers, this patch allows repo-install to assign and store a list
of 'master' build servers for each CPU architecture, then use this to
build artifacts independently for each CPU architecture in the deployment.

Partially-Implements: bp/multi-arch-repo

Change-Id: Ibfb77cc4ce87c9064f9af84946c5a9bbba5e1fb4

commit_message:
Do not deploy inactive plugin

There is no need to display Deploy Changes button on the Dashboard,
if a plugin was installed after a cluster deployment and was not enabled.

Related-Bug: #1594832

Change-Id: Iabd6c1b497ec70fadbd3a437556a7e2f171c48a8

commit_message:
Unlock interfaces of node with "deploy" error type

Now configuration of interfaces is allowed for nodes with
the following statuses:
* status=discover
* status=stopped
* status=error AND error_type=discover
* status=error AND error_type=deploy

Partial-Bug #1592998

Change-Id: I1941dee125a06c7028c8beadc1dfde96829cbc2e

commit_message:
Fix KeyError happened in vim-list

'status' key is not existing in VIM response body, so avoiding
referring to it by VIM['status'].

Change-Id: I2aaae24e2d6d0d30d897fcf018c63983ee6880a4
Closes-bug: #1605111

commit_message:
Enable aodh systemd services on non-bootstrap nodes

Marian Krcmari noticed that on a freshly deployed HA Newton system aodh
was not running on non-bootstrap controller nodes.  Now that the HA NG
work has landed and aodh is managed by systemd on multiple nodes we need
to make sure it is enabled on all nodes that include the aodh base
profiles.

Change-Id: Ifa68ede95ce4136c082664dfdd41bc93c1e2afd6

commit_message:
Grenade upgrade verification changes

From the earlier patch on grenade, following have been updated.
1. OVSDB from base run of neutron is upgraded to the new vswitch schema
   that OVN installation builds.
2. Stop, configure and restart the neutron server and it's agents after ovn
   installation.
3. Since the OVN installation removes the kernel module, the datapath gets
   impacted and the br-ex will have to reconfigured.
4. Add a test network instance in the create phase and verify, if it is present
   in the OVN NB DB in the verify phase.

Change-Id: If2f31867078f626899258a61168042cafd5593fc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/91/343591/27 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash set -o errexit source $GRENADE_DIR/grenaderc #source $GRENADE_DIR/functions source $TOP_DIR/openrc admin admin OVN_TEST_NETWORK=ovn-test-net function early_create { : } function create { local net_id net_id=$(openstack network create $OVN_TEST_NETWORK -f value -c id) resource_save network net_id $net_id } function verify_noapi { : } function verify { local net_id net_id=$(resource_get network net_id) ovn-nbctl list Logical_Switch neutron-$net-id } function destroy { local net_id net_id=$(resource_get network net_id) openstack network delete $net_id } case $1 in "early_create") early_create ;; "create") create ;; "verify_noapi") verify_noapi ;; "verify") verify ;; "destroy") destroy ;; "force_destroy") set +o errexit destroy ;; esac

commit_message:
OS Upgrade tests: separate helpers

1. test_os_upgrade is moved under test_os_upgrade
2. main code is moved to separate place for excluding copy-paste
  in new tests.
3. Fixed logging due to unreadable output
4. Switch to check_call -> remove pain of cherry-picking
5. Use octane-cleanup

Closes-bug: #1612236
Change-Id: Ida7f5901f070a9ef507ce6027fd2618b8617d89f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/10/355910/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Switch back to the net iso HA job

We dropped net iso on the HA job when moving to rh2 as we didn't
have a netiso nics in the OVB envs. We now have these so switch back.

Change-Id: Ieedb4a6daf0e93efc3e3bff7effb5a454cebcece
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/84/348884/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ha|ha2)
deleted_lines: ha) ha2) NODECOUNT=4 # In ci our overcloud nodes don't have access to an external netwrok # --ntp-server is here to make the deploy command happy, the ci env # is on virt so the clocks should be in sync without it. OVERCLOUD_DEPLOY_ARGS="$OVERCLOUD_DEPLOY_ARGS --control-scale 3 --ntp-server 0.centos.pool.ntp.org -e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/puppet-pacemaker.yaml" PACEMAKER=1 ;;

commit_message:
Add authtoken class

Add authtoken class like we do in all other modules, to
configure [keystone_authtoken] section.

And fix metadata

Change-Id: Ie6906c39a6d673c8a960ce481d11fbacf0c4ee1d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tacker refs/changes/79/351779/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # class: tacker::keystone::authtoken # # Configure the keystone_authtoken section in the configuration file # # === Parameters # # [*password*] # (Required) Password to create for the service user # # [*username*] # (Optional) The name of the service user # Defaults to 'tacker' # # [*auth_url*] # (Optional) The URL to use for authentication. # Defaults to 'http://localhost:35357'. # # [*project_name*] # (Optional) Service project name # Defaults to 'services' # # [*user_domain_name*] # (Optional) Name of domain for $username # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*project_domain_name*] # (Optional) Name of domain for $project_name # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*insecure*] # (Optional) If true, explicitly allow TLS without checking server cert # against any certificate authorities. WARNING: not recommended. Use with # caution. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*auth_section*] # (Optional) Config Section from which to load plugin specific options # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*auth_type*] # (Optional) Authentication type to load # Defaults to 'password' # # [*auth_uri*] # (Optional) Complete public Identity API endpoint. # Defaults to 'http://localhost:5000'. # # [*auth_version*] # (Optional) API version of the admin Identity API endpoint. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*cache*] # (Optional) Env key for the swift cache. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*cafile*] # (Optional) A PEM encoded Certificate Authority to use when verifying HTTPs # connections. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*certfile*] # (Optional) Required if identity server requires client certificate # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*check_revocations_for_cached*] # (Optional) If true, the revocation list will be checked for cached tokens. # This requires that PKI tokens are configured on the identity server. # boolean value. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*delay_auth_decision*] # (Optional) Do not handle authorization requests within the middleware, but # delegate the authorization decision to downstream WSGI components. Boolean # value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*enforce_token_bind*] # (Optional) Used to control the use and type of token binding. Can be set # to: "disabled" to not check token binding. "permissive" (default) to # validate binding information if the bind type is of a form known to the # server and ignore it if not. "strict" like "permissive" but if the bind # type is unknown the token will be rejected. "required" any form of token # binding is needed to be allowed. Finally the name of a binding method that # must be present in tokens. String value. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*hash_algorithms*] # (Optional) Hash algorithms to use for hashing PKI tokens. This may be a # single algorithm or multiple. The algorithms are those supported by Python # standard hashlib.new(). The hashes will be tried in the order given, so put # the preferred one first for performance. The result of the first hash will # be stored in the cache. This will typically be set to multiple values only # while migrating from a less secure algorithm to a more secure one. Once all # the old tokens are expired this option should be set to a single value for # better performance. List value. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*http_connect_timeout*] # (Optional) Request timeout value for communicating with Identity API # server. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*http_request_max_retries*] # (Optional) How many times are we trying to reconnect when communicating # with Identity API Server. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*include_service_catalog*] # (Optional) Indicate whether to set the X-Service-Catalog header. If False, # middleware will not ask for service catalog on token validation and will # not # set the X-Service-Catalog header. Boolean value. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*keyfile*] # (Optional) Required if identity server requires client certificate # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcache_pool_conn_get_timeout*] # (Optional) Number of seconds that an operation will wait to get a memcached # client connection from the pool. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcache_pool_dead_retry*] # (Optional) Number of seconds memcached server is considered dead before it # is tried again. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcache_pool_maxsize*] # (Optional) Maximum total number of open connections to every memcached # server. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcache_pool_socket_timeout*] # (Optional) Number of seconds a connection to memcached is held unused in # the # pool before it is closed. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcache_pool_unused_timeout*] # (Optional) Number of seconds a connection to memcached is held unused in # the # pool before it is closed. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcache_secret_key*] # (Optional, mandatory if memcache_security_strategy is defined) This string # is used for key derivation. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcache_security_strategy*] # (Optional) If defined, indicate whether token data should be authenticated # or # authenticated and encrypted. If MAC, token data is authenticated (with # HMAC) # in the cache. If ENCRYPT, token data is encrypted and authenticated in the # cache. If the value is not one of these options or empty, auth_token will # raise an exception on initialization. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcache_use_advanced_pool*] # (Optional) Use the advanced (eventlet safe) memcached client pool. The # advanced pool will only work under python 2.x Boolean value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcached_servers*] # (Optional) Optionally specify a list of memcached server(s) to use for # caching. If left undefined, tokens will instead be cached in-process. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*region_name*] # (Optional) The region in which the identity server can be found. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*revocation_cache_time*] # (Optional) Determines the frequency at which the list of revoked tokens is # retrieved from the Identity service (in seconds). A high number of # revocation events combined with a low cache duration may significantly # reduce performance. Only valid for PKI tokens. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*signing_dir*] # (Optional) Directory used to cache files related to PKI tokens. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*token_cache_time*] # (Optional) In order to prevent excessive effort spent validating tokens, # the middleware caches previously-seen tokens for a configurable duration # (in seconds). Set to -1 to disable caching completely. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # class tacker::keystone::authtoken( $password, $username = 'tacker', $auth_url = 'http://localhost:35357', $project_name = 'services', added_lines: This chapter documents :command:`gnocchi` version ``2.5.0``. usage: gnocchi [--version] [-v | -q] [--log-file LOG_FILE] [-h] [--debug] [--os-user-id OS_USER_ID] [--os-username OS_USERNAME] [--os-password OS_PASSWORD] [--endpoint ENDPOINT]``--log-file LOG_FILE`` Specify a file to log output. Disabled by default. ``--endpoint ENDPOINT``----------------------------- [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [--noindent] [--prefix PREFIX] -d <DEFINITION> [-b BACK_WINDOW] [-m AGGREGATION_METHODS]**Positional arguments:****Optional arguments:**``-d <DEFINITION>, --definition <DEFINITION>`` two attributes (separated by ',') of an archive policy definition with its name and value separated with a ':' -----------------------------**Positional arguments:****Optional arguments:**--------------------------- usage: gnocchi archive-policy list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}]**Optional arguments:**--------------------------- [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}]**Positional arguments:****Optional arguments:**.. _gnocchi_archive-policy_update: gnocchi archive-policy update ----------------------------- usage: gnocchi archive-policy update [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--noindent] [--prefix PREFIX] -d <DEFINITION> name Update an archive policy **Positional arguments:** ``name`` name of the archive policy **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit ``-d <DEFINITION>, --definition <DEFINITION>`` two attributes (separated by ',') of an archive policy definition with its name and value separated with a ':'---------------------------------- [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}]**Positional arguments:****Optional arguments:**----------------------------------**Positional arguments:****Optional arguments:**-------------------------------- [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}]**Optional arguments:**-------------------------------- [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}]**Positional arguments:****Optional arguments:**------------------------------ [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [--timestamp-end TIMESTAMP_END] [--wait]**Positional arguments:****Optional arguments:**``--wait`` Wait for all measures to be processed ------------------------------- [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [--granularity GRANULARITY]**Positional arguments:****Optional arguments:**``--granularity GRANULARITY`` granularity to retrieve (in seconds) ------------------------------- [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}]**Optional arguments:**----------------------------- [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}]**Positional arguments:****Optional arguments:**------------------------- usage: gnocchi capabilities list [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}]**Optional arguments:**--------------------**Positional arguments:****Optional arguments:**.. _gnocchi_measures_batch-metrics: gnocchi measures batch-metrics ------------------------------ usage: gnocchi measures batch-metrics [-h] file **Positional arguments:** ``file`` File containing measurements to batch or - for stdin (see Gnocchi REST API docs for the format **Optional arguments:**.. _gnocchi_measures_batch-resources-metrics: gnocchi measures batch-resources-metrics ---------------------------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: gnocchi measures batch-resources-metrics [-h] file **Positional arguments:** ``file`` File containing measurements to batch or - for stdin (see Gnocchi REST API docs for the format **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit--------------------- usage: gnocchi measures show [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}] [--stop STOP] [--granularity GRANULARITY]**Positional arguments:****Optional arguments:**``--granularity GRANULARITY`` granularity to retrieve (in seconds) --------------------- [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [--unit UNIT]**Positional arguments:****Optional arguments:**``--unit UNIT, -u UNIT`` unit of the metric ---------------------**Positional arguments:****Optional arguments:**------------------- usage: gnocchi metric list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}]**Optional arguments:**------------------- usage: gnocchi metric show [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}]**Positional arguments:****Optional arguments:**----------------------- usage: gnocchi resource create [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}]**Positional arguments:****Optional arguments:** name and value of an attribute separated with a ':'-----------------------**Positional arguments:****Optional arguments:**------------------------ usage: gnocchi resource history [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}]**Positional arguments:****Optional arguments:** Sort of resource attribute (example: user_id:desc-nullslast--------------------- usage: gnocchi resource list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}]**Optional arguments:** Sort of resource attribute (example: user_id:desc-nullslast--------------------- usage: gnocchi resource show [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}]**Positional arguments:****Optional arguments:**----------------------- usage: gnocchi resource update [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}]**Positional arguments:****Optional arguments:** name and value of an attribute separated with a ':'.. _gnocchi_resource-type_create: gnocchi resource-type create ---------------------------- usage: gnocchi resource-type create [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--noindent] [--prefix PREFIX] [-a ATTRIBUTE] name Create a resource type **Positional arguments:** ``name`` name of the resource type **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit ``-a ATTRIBUTE, --attribute ATTRIBUTE`` attribute definition, attribute_name:attribute_type:at tribute_is_required:attribute_type_option_name=attribu te_type_option_value:… For example: display_name:string:true:max_length=255 .. _gnocchi_resource-type_delete: gnocchi resource-type delete ---------------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: gnocchi resource-type delete [-h] name Delete a resource type **Positional arguments:** ``name`` name of the resource type **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit .. _gnocchi_resource-type_list: gnocchi resource-type list -------------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: gnocchi resource-type list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--noindent] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}] List resource types **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--noindent] [--prefix PREFIX] name Show a resource type **Positional arguments:** ``name`` name of the resource type **Optional commit_message:
Revert "Verify cellsv2 setup after upgrade"

This reverts commit c35a703a2c25538194880f390888c618d2e51b4e,
which breaks Ironic's jobs. For example:
http://logs.openstack.org/32/296432/96/check/gate-grenade-dsvm-ironic/5822903/logs/grenade.sh.txt.gz#_2016-08-16_08_41_27_175

Change-Id: I2aa88bd0fbebb1381198f0f74829a0d4b2a721eb
Related-Bug: #1613622

commit_message:
[ha-guide] Add crmsh config command for haproxy

Add HAProxy to the cluster and ensure the VIPs can only run on machines
where HAProxy is active by crmsh.

Change-Id: I8f91ba9778ce342e8c7ae7f6caaf8d0bbc49dfb2
Closes-bug: #1585207
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/11/320211/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove unneeded net_ip_map dump into hieradata

We will lookup bind addresses using map_replace within the templates
so dumping net_ip_map as hieradata is unneeded.

Change-Id: If54c9033fc58d2cfaa040e30adeed7f58e44fd88

added_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2016-08-16 09:43+0000\n""PO-Revision-Date: 2016-08-17 04:09+0000\n"msgstr "Alamat lingkup (Address scopes)"msgstr "Konfigurasi lanjutan (Advanced configuration)"msgstr "Lampiran"msgstr "Jaringan Dasar (Basic networking)"msgstr "Dafter Isi"msgstr "Skenario pengerahan (Deployment scenarios)"msgstr "Glosarium""menghindari tabrakan dengan layanan lainnya. commit_message:
Remove deprecated net_ip_uri_map output

Takes the net_ip_uri_map value from the *_uri values emitted
by net_ip_map instead.

Also removes TenantIp and TenantIpUri from net_vip_map_external
templates as there won't be any VIP on the tenant network.

Change-Id: Icdac3d58162891f5ca3d5c20f14fcdff1781996f

commit_message:
Prevent Ironic multitenancy job running on old versions

Multitenancy support was only added in Newton so we shouldn't be running
this job against stable/liberty or mitaka.

Change-Id: I0eba0dfd5daab20e670ed38b800e4f9902865f29

subject: Add exception handle to delete vnf in functional tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-06 09:27:08.000000000', 'files': ['tacker/tests/functional/vnfm/test_tosca_vnf.py', 'tacker/tests/functional/vnfm/test_vnf_monitoring.py', 'tacker/tests/functional/vnfm/test_tosca_vnf_multiple_vdu.py', 'tacker/tests/functional/vnfm/test_vnf_multiple_vdu.py', 'tacker/tests/functional/vnfm/test_vnf.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tacker/commit/9b038216458611cd78c66211dda26383f035a193', 'message': 'Add exception handle to delete vnf in functional tests

In current code files, the exception handle of deleting vnf
in functional tests like this:

 # Delete vnf_instance with vnf_id
        try:
            self.client.delete_vnf(vnf_id)
        except Exception:
            assert False, "vnf Delete of test_vnf_with_multiple_vdus failed"
This case just judge the failure of deleting vnf. But if it
didn't delete vnf, there is no possibility of falilure. So this code:

        except Exception:
            assert False, "vnf Delete of test_vnf_with_multiple_vdus failed"

will be skipped. But acctually, most cases we just think about
delete vnfd successfully. This judgement is wrong.
So add a exception handle like this:

 # Delete vnf_instance with vnf_id
        try:
            self.client.delete_vnf(vnf_id)
        except Exception:
            assert False, "vnf Delete of test_vnf_with_multiple_vdus failed"
        try:
            vnf_d = self.client.show_vnf(vnf_id)
        except Exception:
            assert True, "Vnf Delete success" + str(vnf_d) + str(Exception)

Use show_vnf(vnf_id) again, which make sure the success of deleting vnf.

Change-Id: If298830fb5e0434424885bc16bea606e5447cb4c
'}]
commit_message:
Add exception handle to delete vnf in functional tests

In current code files, the exception handle of deleting vnf
in functional tests like this:

 # Delete vnf_instance with vnf_id
        try:
            self.client.delete_vnf(vnf_id)
        except Exception:
            assert False, "vnf Delete of test_vnf_with_multiple_vdus failed"
This case just judge the failure of deleting vnf. But if it
didn't delete vnf, there is no possibility of falilure. So this code:

        except Exception:
            assert False, "vnf Delete of test_vnf_with_multiple_vdus failed"

will be skipped. But acctually, most cases we just think about
delete vnfd successfully. This judgement is wrong.
So add a exception handle like this:

 # Delete vnf_instance with vnf_id
        try:
            self.client.delete_vnf(vnf_id)
        except Exception:
            assert False, "vnf Delete of test_vnf_with_multiple_vdus failed"
        try:
            vnf_d = self.client.show_vnf(vnf_id)
        except Exception:
            assert True, "Vnf Delete success" + str(vnf_d) + str(Exception)

Use show_vnf(vnf_id) again, which make sure the success of deleting vnf.

Change-Id: If298830fb5e0434424885bc16bea606e5447cb4c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker refs/changes/14/352014/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: vnf_d = self.client.show_vnf(vnf_id) except Exception: assert True, "Vnf Delete success" + str(vnf_d) + str(Exception)

commit_message:
Implement Cinder Infra Protection Plugin

Change-Id: Ifb25978c9676d18bb8940e95a3e6adeb11796f8e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/karbor refs/changes/98/310498/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from cinderclient import exceptions as c_exc from oslo_log import log as logging from smaug.common import constants from smaug import exception as exc from smaug.services.protection.client_factory import ClientFactory LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) schema = {} class ProtectionPlugin(object): _SUPPORTED_RESOURCE_TYPES = ['OS::Cinder::Volume'] def __init__(self, config=None): self._config = config def get_supported_resources_types(self): return self._SUPPORTED_RESOURCE_TYPES def get_options_schema(self, resource_type): return schema['protect'] def get_saved_info_schema(self, resource_type): return schema['info'] def get_restore_schema(self, resource_type): return schema['restore'] def get_saved_info(self, metadata_store, resource): pass def get_protection_stats(self, protection_id): pass def set_activities(self, activities, operation_type, resource): if operation_type == constants.OPERATION_PROTECT: activities.add_worker_activity(self.protect) elif operation_type == constants.OPERATION_DELETE: activities.add_worker_activity(self.delete) elif operation_type == constants.OPERATION_RESTORE: activities.add_worker_activity(self.restore) def _cinder_client(context): return ClientFactory.create('cinder', context) def protect(self, checkpoint, resource, context, parameters): resource_section = checkpoint.get_resource_section(resource.id) resource_section.status = constants.CHECKPOINT_STATUS_PROTECTING cc = self._cinder_client(context) incremental = None backup_mode = parameters.get('backup_mode') if backup_mode == 'incremental': incremental = True elif backup_mode == 'full': incremental = False backup = cc.backups.create(resource.id, container=parameters.get('container', None), name=parameters.get('backup_name', None), description=parameters.get('description', None), incremental=incremental, force=parameters.get('force')) backup_id = backup.id resource_section.meta_data['backup_id'] = backup.id while True: backup = cc.backups.get(backup_id) if backup.status == 'available': resource_section.status = constants.CHECKPOINT_STATUS_AVAILABLE elif backup.status == 'creating': yield else: if backup.status == 'error': reason = backup.fail_reason else: reason = ('Volume should be creating or available. ' 'The volume status is: %s').format(backup.status) resource_section.status = constants.CHECKPOINT_STATUS_ERROR raise exc.ResourceProtectFailed( resource_id=resource.id, resource_type=resource.type, reason=reason) def delete(self, checkpoint, resource, context, parameters): resource_section = checkpoint.get_resource_section(resource.id) resource_section.status = constants.CHECKPOINT_STATUS_DELETING cc = self._cinder_client(context) backup_id = resource_section.meta_data.get('backup_id') backup = cc.backups.get(backup_id) cc.backups.delete(backup) while True: try: backup = cc.backups.get(backup_id) except c_exc.NotFound: resource_section.status = constants.CHECKPOINT_STATUS_DELETED return if backup.status == 'deleting': yield else: if backup.status == 'error_deleting': reason = backup.fail_reason else: reason = ('Volume should be deleting or not existent. ' 'The volume status is: %s').format(backup.status) raise exc.ResourceDeleteFailed( resource_id=resource.id, resource_type=resource.type, reason=reason) def restore(self, checkpoint, resource, context, parameters): resource_section = checkpoint.get_resource_section(resource.id) cc = self._cinder_client(context) backup_id = resource_section.meta_data.get('backup_id') restore = cc.restores.restore( backup_id=backup_id, volume_id=parameters.get('volume_id', None)) restore_id = restore.id while True: restore = cc.volumes.get(restore_id).status if restore.status == 'available': resource_section.status = constants.CHECKPOINT_STATUS_AVAILABLE elif restore.status == 'restoring-backup': yield else: if restore.status == 'error_restoring': reason = restore.fail_reason else: reason = ( 'Volume should be restoring-backup or available. The ' 'volume status is: %s' ).format(restore.status) resource_section.status = constants.CHECKPOINT_STATUS_ERROR raise exc.ResourceRestoreFailed( resource_id=resource.id, resource_type=resource.type, reason=reason) schema['protect'] = { "title": "Cinder Protection Options", "type": "object", "properties": { "backup_name": { "type": "string", "title": "Backup Name", "description": "The name of the backup." }, "backup_mode": { "type": "string", "title": "Backup Mode", "description": "The backup mode.", "enum": ["full", "incremental", "auto"], "default": "auto" }, "container": { "type": "string", "title": "Container", "description": "The container which been chosen." }, "description": { "type": "string", "title": "Description", "description": "The description of the volume." }, "force": { "type": "boolean", "title": "Force", "description": "Whether to backup, even if the volume" "is attached", "default": False } }, "required": ["backup_name", "backup_mode", "container", "force"] } schema['restore'] = { "title": "Cinder Protection Restore", "type": "object", "properties": { "volume_id": { "type": "string", "title": "Volume ID", "description": "The target volume ID to restore to." }, }, } schema['info'] = { "title": "Cinder Protection Saved Info", "type": "object", "properties": { "name": { "type": "string", "title": "Name", "description": "The name for this backup." }, "is_incremental": { "type": "boolean", "title": "Is Incremental", "description": "The type of the backup, " "True is incremental and False is full." }, "status": { "type": "string", "title": "Status", "description": "The backup status, such as available.", "enum": ["creating", "available", "deleting", "error", "restoring", "error_restoring"], }, "progress": { "type": "number", "title": "Progress", "description": "The current operation progress for this backup.", "constraint": {"min": 0, "max": 1}, }, "fail_reason": { "type": "string", "title": "Fail Reason", "description": "The reason for the failure status of the backup." }, "size": { "type": "integer", "title": "Size", "description": "The size of the backup, in GB." }, "volume_id": { "type": "string", "title": "Volume ID", "description": ("The ID of the volume " "from which the backup was created.") }, }, "required": ["name", "status", "progress", "fail_reason", "size", "volume_id"] }

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-27 09:31:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/karbor/commit/03b7e2e25a9c0aed120a1d81f55277cd22bd13b9', 'message': "Implement the Resource Flow

Protection plugin now needs to implement the set_activities()
method, which will be called with an Activity object. It is the
protection plugin's reponsibility to set activities for each
operation (protect, delete, restore).

Activity can be any callable. In case the activity returns a
generator, it is iterated until completion. The iteration interval
is defined in configuration. The last yielded value is taken as the
activity result.

Main activity is called after worker activities and dependent
resource's main activities are complete.
Worker activities are called independently of other activities
status.

Change-Id: I67299bcb915ec964b676b4a1e4c56d9bc89c9513

commit_message:
Implement the Resource Flow

Protection plugin now needs to implement the set_activities()
method, which will be called with an Activity object. It is the
protection plugin's reponsibility to set activities for each
operation (protect, delete, restore).

Activity can be any callable. In case the activity returns a
generator, it is iterated until completion. The iteration interval
is defined in configuration. The last yielded value is taken as the
activity result.

Main activity is called after worker activities and dependent
resource's main activities are complete.
Worker activities are called independently of other activities
status.

Change-Id: I67299bcb915ec964b676b4a1e4c56d9bc89c9513

commit_message:
Create and provide HeatTemplate from workflow

Previously, HeatTemplate was created and passed to resource tasks
before the restore operation began.
In this patch, a new task 'CreateHeatTask' begins before all resource
tasks. It creates the a Heat client and a HeatTemplate, providing it
for resource tasks, as well as CreateStackTask and
SyncStackStatusTask.

Change-Id: Ifc48c7b4dfcdf4f67c1459bf35a832509e17d535
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/karbor refs/changes/30/322830/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_utils import uuidutilsfrom smaug.services.protection import client_factory from smaug.services.protection import restore_heatclass CreateHeatTask(task.Task): provides = ['heat_client', 'heat_template'] def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): super(CreateHeatTask, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) def execute(self, context, heat_conf): heat_client = client_factory.ClientFactory.create_client( 'heat', context=context, conf=heat_conf) heat_template = restore_heat.HeatTemplate() return (heat_client, heat_template) class CreateStackTask(task.Task): provides = 'stack_id' def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): super(CreateStackTask, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) def execute(self, heat_client, heat_template): stack_name = "restore_%s" % uuidutils.generate_uuid() body = heat_client.stacks.create( template=heat_template.to_dict()) requires = ['stack_id'] def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): super(SyncStackStatusTask, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) def execute(self, stack_id, heat_client): self._sync_status, heat_client, stack_id) sync_status_loop.wait() def _sync_status(self, heat_client, stack_id): try: stack = heat_client.stacks.get(stack_id) # TODO(yuvalbr) handle stack create failure heat_conf = {"auth_url": target, "username": username, "password": password} resource_graph = checkpoint.resource_graph parameters = restore.parameters resource_flow = provider.build_task_flow(operation_type=operation_type, context=context, workflow_engine=workflow_engine, resource_graph=resource_graph, parameters=parameters) workflow_engine.add_tasks(CreateHeatTask(inject={'context': context, 'heat_conf': heat_conf}), restoration_flow, CreateStackTask(), SyncStackStatusTask())
deleted_lines: from uuid import uuid4from smaug.services.protection.clients import heat from smaug.services.protection.restore_heat import HeatTemplateclass CreateStackTask(task.Task): def __init__(self, heat_client, template): provides = 'stack_id' super(CreateStackTask, self).__init__(provides=provides) self._heat_client = heat_client self._template = template def execute(self): stack_name = "restore_%s" % str(uuid4()) body = self._heat_client.stacks.create( template=self._template.to_dict()) def __init__(self, checkpoint, heat_client): requires = ['stack_id'] super(SyncStackStatusTask, self).__init__(requires=requires) self._heat_client = heat_client self._checkpoint = checkpoint def execute(self, stack_id): self._sync_status, self._checkpoint, stack_id) def _sync_status(self, checkpoint, stack_id): try: stack = self._heat_client.stacks.get(stack_id) # TODO(luobin): create a heat_client heat_client_conf = {"auth_url": target, "username": username, "password": password} heat_client = heat.create(context=context, conf=heat_client_conf) # TODO(luobin): create a heat_template heat_template = HeatTemplate() ctx = {'context': context, 'checkpoint': checkpoint, 'workflow_engine': workflow_engine, 'operation_type': operation_type, 'restore': restore, 'heat_template': heat_template} result = provider.build_task_flow(ctx) resource_flow = result.get('task_flow') workflow_engine.add_tasks(restoration_flow, CreateStackTask(heat_client, heat_template), SyncStackStatusTask(checkpoint, heat_client))

Add tests for Reduced Footprint feature

* Deploy ha_compact on one HW node

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/15/215915/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Snapshot: spawn_one_vm_on_one_virt_node self.check_run("spawn_one_vm_on_one_virt_node") "mem": settings.HARDWARE['slave_node_memory'] / 1024, "cpu": settings.HARDWARE['slave_node_cpu'] self.env.make_snapshot("spawn_one_vm_on_one_virt_node", is_make=True) @test(groups=["reduced_footprint"]) class TestReducedFoorprint(TestBasic): """Reduced footprint tests Reduced footprint is about deployment cluster on reduced number of physical nodes. The minimal nodes count is 5 for the default implementation and HA mode (1 master, 3 controllers, 1 compute/storage). Reduced footprint allows to use not production ready setup on 1 node and full working HA will be possible with 3 physical nodes (each controller located on other physical server). """ def update_virtual_nodes(self, cluster_id, nodes_dict): """Update nodes attributes with nailgun client. FuelWebClient.update_nodes uses devops nodes as data source. Virtual nodes are not in devops database so we have to update nodes attributes manually via nailgun client. """ nodes = self.fuel_web.client.list_nodes() virt_nodes = [node for node in nodes if node['cluster'] != cluster_id] asserts.assert_equal(len(nodes_dict), len(virt_nodes), "Length of given nodes dict is differ from " "count of available nodes in nailgun:\n" "Nodes dict: {0}\nAvailable nodes: {1}" .format(nodes_dict, [node['name'] for node in virt_nodes])) for virt_node, virt_node_name in zip(virt_nodes, nodes_dict): new_roles = nodes_dict[virt_node_name] new_name = '{}_{}'.format(virt_node_name, "_".join(new_roles)) data = {"cluster_id": cluster_id, "pending_addition": True, "pending_deletion": False, "pending_roles": new_roles, "name": new_name} self.fuel_web.client.update_node(virt_node['id'], data) self.fuel_web.update_nodes_interfaces(cluster_id, virt_nodes) @test(depends_on=[TestVirtRole.spawn_one_vm_on_one_virt_node], groups=["deploy_ha_compact_on_one_node"]) @log_snapshot_after_test def deploy_ha_compact_on_one_node(self): """Deploy ha_compact on one HW node Scenario: 1. Revert ready_one_virt_one_vm snapshot 2. Assign controller role to VM and deploy ha_compact 3. Run Network tests 4. Run OSTF check Environment variables: - SLAVE_NODE_CPU: recommended value 4 - SLAVE_NODE_MEMORY: recommended value 4096 Duration 310m """ self.env.revert_snapshot("spawn_one_vm_on_one_virt_node") cluster_id = self.fuel_web.get_last_created_cluster() self.update_virtual_nodes(cluster_id, { 'slave-02': ['controller'], }) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id, timeout=4 * 60 * 60) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.fuel_web.run_ostf(cluster_id)

Change-Id: Ic1363f7464e9b81d65d74fc30b525d0bd06103ed
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-17 05:34:30.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/c283f8bf5007b044d6d46a016d59d995dccc8aa3', 'message': 'Don't use config option sqlite_db

Change-Id: Ic1363f7464e9b81d65d74fc30b525d0bd06103ed

commit_message:
Don't use config option sqlite_db

Config option sqlite_db is deprecated in
0a1bae9859079fb21a03716be947c5f1da6db0a2, and we test database
with sqlite in memory mode [1] as below:

CONF.set_default('connection', "sqlite://", group='database')

and never use config option sqlite_db, so don't need override its
default value.

[1]http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/rel_1_0/core/engines.html#sqlite

Change-Id: Ic1363f7464e9b81d65d74fc30b525d0bd06103ed

subject: Wait for a non-empty chunk in WSGIContext._app_call
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-12 05:51:58.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/wsgi.py', 'test/unit/common/test_wsgi.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/f7a820ed3a72992948e22e7366a9a1780ad40388', 'message': "Wait for a non-empty chunk in WSGIContext._app_call

We're functioning as a WSGI server here, so this bit from PEP-3333 seems
to apply:

> The start_response callable must not actually transmit the response
> headers. Instead, it must store them for the server or gateway to
> transmit only after the first iteration of the application return
> value that yields a non-empty bytestrin ... . In other words, response
> headers must not be sent until there is actual body data available, or
> until the application's returned iterable is exhausted.

Plus, it mirrors what swob.Request.call_application does.

Change-Id: I1e8501f8ce91ea912780db64fee1c56bef809a98
"}]
commit_message:
Wait for a non-empty chunk in WSGIContext._app_call

We're functioning as a WSGI server here, so this bit from PEP-3333 seems
to apply:

> The start_response callable must not actually transmit the response
> headers. Instead, it must store them for the server or gateway to
> transmit only after the first iteration of the application return
> value that yields a non-empty bytestrin ... . In other words, response
> headers must not be sent until there is actual body data available, or
> until the application's returned iterable is exhausted.

Plus, it mirrors what swob.Request.call_application does.

Change-Id: I1e8501f8ce91ea912780db64fee1c56bef809a98

commit_message:
Add cinder-backup service as role

Tempest tests for cinder contain backup tests that fail
unless cinder-backup service is started. This patch facilitates
the service start upon the overcloud deployment.

Original patch converted to composable role.

Co-Authored-By: Giulio Fidente <gfidente@redhat.com>
Depends-On: Ib1dfe52b83ab01819fc669312967950e75d8ddf1
Change-Id: I9ca97b3f1c26aac6d81b3525377e1f5fb962313f

added_lines: pacemaker::resource::service { $::cinder::params::backup_service : }

commit_message:
Update info in the configuration file

Since there are so many components in openstack,
by describing the URL info in the configuration file,
it is more convenient to find the developer documentation than from
the unified portal

Change-Id: I2665f0da7c7ab6d425dae4e06dc3c515af47af52

subject: Avoid duplicate sections in generator output
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-16 11:36:18.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/tests/test_generator.py', 'oslo_config/generator.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config/commit/2a723953eefb30eb0695d2a511f54689c7cae67c', 'message': 'Avoid duplicate sections in generator output

This change avoids the dupes by always keying the group list on

Change-Id: I2cd8ae87a1f573b5837d292abcf7babf5d88bee5

commit_message:
Avoid duplicate sections in generator output

Because option groups can be specified as either bare strings or
OptGroup objects, it is possible to end up with duplicate sections
in the resulting output file.  This is confusing, and can cause
problems for config management systems so we should avoid doing it.

This change avoids the dupes by always keying the group list on
the group name, but including the OptGroup object in the data
when available so the output code can make use of the extra
information in an OptGroup.

Co-Authored-By: Alexis Lee <lxsli@hpe.com>
Change-Id: I2cd8ae87a1f573b5837d292abcf7babf5d88bee5
Closes-Bug: 1568820
(cherry picked from commit 01ed4fccf27ef32449bfe3d36af754c8659d0720)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config refs/changes/65/355865/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _output_opts(f, group, group_data): f.format_group(group_data['object'] or group) for (namespace, opts) in sorted(group_data['namespaces'],def _get_groups(conf_ns): """Invert a list of groups by namespace into a dict by group name. :param conf_ns: a list of (namespace, [(<group>, [opt_1, opt_2])]) tuples, such as returned by _list_opts. :returns: {<group_name>, {'object': <group_object>, 'namespaces': [(<namespace>, <opts>)]}} <group> may be a string or a group object. <group_name> is always a string. <group_object> will only be set if <group> was a group object in at least one namespace. Keying by group_name avoids adding duplicate group names in case a group is added as both an OptGroup and as a str, but still makes the additional OptGroup data available to the output code when possible. """ groups = {'DEFAULT': {'object': None, 'namespaces': []}} group = group if group else 'DEFAULT' is_optgroup = hasattr(group, 'name') group_name = group.name if is_optgroup else group if group_name not in groups: groups[group_name] = {'object': None, 'namespaces': []} if is_optgroup: groups[group_name]['object'] = group groups[group_name]['namespaces'].append((namespace, opts)) for group, group_data in sorted(groups.items()): _output_opts(formatter, group, group_data)
deleted_lines: def _output_opts(f, group, namespaces): f.format_group(group) for (namespace, opts) in sorted(namespaces,def _get_group_name(item): group = item[0] # The keys of the groups dictionary could be an OptGroup. Otherwise the # help text of an OptGroup wouldn't be part of the generated sample # file. It could also be just a plain group name without any further # attributes. That's the reason why we have to differentiate here. return group.name if isinstance(group, cfg.OptGroup) else group def _get_groups(conf_ns): groups = {'DEFAULT': []} namespaces = groups.setdefault(group or 'DEFAULT', []) namespaces.append((namespace, opts)) for group, namespaces in sorted(groups.items(), key=_get_group_name): _output_opts(formatter, group, namespaces)

commit_message:
Use python-db-jobs for tap-as-a-service

We want to add some DB tests that don't need the overhead of
adding a full functional job.

Change-Id: I5775c8525f4e79336a8aaa46ff8e7f07365f015e
Related-bug: #1605675

commit_message:
Make the grenade job voting on ironic-inspector

It has been pretty stable recently, so let's make it voting.
As before, it only runs on master (aka Newton).

commit_message:
Rename bifrost integration test job

Bifrost recently changed from using a coreos based IPA image
to a tinyos IPA image in order to improve CI test performance
and reliability.  As such, the main integration test job should
be renamed to reflect the present state of the job.

Change-Id: Ib876e6e6b553a1ef44a26e96059e566d13bbc3a5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/52/355652/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: ^.*bifrost-(python27|integration-tinyipa-cirros|integration-dibipa-debian-nv|integration-dhcp-nv)$ - gate-bifrost-integration-tinyipa-cirros - gate-bifrost-integration-tinyipa-cirros

'}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2016-06-04 01:07:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/91681e7e51ad5700e74aa99a5e88b67649345d74', 'message': "Add REST API support for get me a network

This adds the microversion to the REST API for automatically
allocating a network, i.e. get me a network.

The majority of the changes to the REST API concern request
validation. 'networks' is now required in the server POST body
after this microversion. The 'auto' or 'none' special network
uuid values are used, but if specified, can not be specified
with any other requested network values.

The other special case that is checked is when the minimum
compute service version is not new enough to support this change,
i.e. a Mitaka compute will not have the network API code that
knows how to deal with the special auto/none network IDs. Because
the REST API is checking the service version, the service caches
the service version after the first check. Once all computes are
updated to Newton then a restart of the nova-api service(s) will
be required to flush the cache. A release note is provided for
this situation.

Implements blueprint get-me-a-network

Change-Id: I89b18709e0cfbbcbf9be96a91a13a1356cdf85b0
"}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2016-06-04 13:31:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/31556c141e98e312f728464a61cbbfa7f4bab98c', 'message': "Add REST API support for get me a network

i.e. a Mitaka compute will not have the network API code that
knows how to deal with the special auto/none network IDs. Because
the REST API is checking the service version, the service caches
the service version after the first check. Once all computes are
updated to Newton then a restart of the nova-api service(s) will
be required to flush the cache. A release note is provided for
this situation.

The api-ref docs are also updated for this microversion including
an example API sample request.

Implements blueprint get-me-a-network

Change-Id: I89b18709e0cfbbcbf9be96a91a13a1356cdf85b0
"}, {'number': 18, 'created': '2016-06-16 22:42:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/180f22cc3329cbac67ceabda2e328317258fde73', 'message': "Add REST API support for get me a network

This adds the microversion to the REST API for automatically
allocating a network, i.e. get me a network.

The majority of the changes to the REST API concern request
validation. 'networks' is now required in the server POST body
after this microversion. The 'auto' or 'none' special network
uuid values are used, but if specified, can not be specified
with any other requested network values.

The other special case that is checked is when the minimum
compute service version is not new enough to support this change,
i.e. a Mitaka compute will not have the network API code that
knows how to deal with the special auto/none network IDs. Because
the REST API is checking the service version, the service caches
the service version after the first check. Once all computes are
updated to Newton then a restart of the nova-api service(s) will
be required to flush the cache. A release note is provided for
this situation.

The api-ref docs are also updated for this microversion including
an example API sample request.

Implements blueprint get-me-a-network

commit_message:
Add REST API support for get me a network

This adds the 2.37 microversion to the REST API for automatically
allocating a network, i.e. get me a network.

The majority of the changes to the REST API concern request
validation. 'networks' is now required in the server POST body
after this microversion. The 'auto' or 'none' special network
uuid values are used, but if specified, can not be specified
with any other requested network values.

The other special case that is checked is when the minimum
compute service version is not new enough to support this change,
i.e. a Mitaka compute will not have the network API code that
knows how to deal with the special auto/none network IDs. Because
the REST API is checking the service version, the service caches
the service version after the first check. Once all computes are
updated to Newton then a restart of the nova-api service(s) will
be required to flush the cache. A release note is provided for
this situation.

The api-ref docs are also updated for this microversion including
an example API sample request.

The matching Tempest change to test this is here:

I89b18709e0cfbbcbf9be96a91a13a1356cdf85b0

The matching python-novaclient change is here:

I6636ddcd3be7bf393d2d69cc6c1ba5c7d65ff674

Implements blueprint get-me-a-network

Change-Id: I89b18709e0cfbbcbf9be96a91a13a1356cdf85b0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/98/316398/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 2.27 ---- Added support for automatic allocation of networking, also known as "Get Me a Network". With this microversion, when requesting the creation of a new server (or servers) the ``networks`` entry in the ``server`` portion of the request body is required. The ``uuid`` entry in a ``networks`` object of the request can have one of three values: #. The UUID of a specific network that the user/project has access to. #. *none* which means no networking will be allocated for the created server(s). #. *auto* which means either a network that is already available to the project will be used, or if one does not exist, will be automatically created for the project. Automatic network allocation for a project only happens once for a project. Subsequent requests using *auto* for the same project will reuse the network that was previously allocated. When using the Neutron networking service, servers can be created with specific pre-existing ports, but one can not specify a port and *auto* or *none* for the network uuid.

commit_message:
Add cinder-backup profiles

Adds a Cinder backup profile for Cinder backup service activation
(to be used in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/304563).

Cinder backup uses Swift as a default.

Change-Id: Ib1dfe52b83ab01819fc669312967950e75d8ddf1
Co-Authored-By: Jon Bernard <jobernar@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Boris Kreitchman <bkreitch@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Change default apt sources to standard Ubuntu sources

The current default apt source ``https://mirror.rackspace.com/ubuntu``
sometimes has broken package indexes or missing packages.

The default package source has therefore been changed to make use of
``http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu`` for packages and
``http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu`` for security packages.

Change-Id: I494face7173ecc054fe21a7c08b221e4be3cfcb7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/52/355452/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Invalid api response in case all graphs deleted

In the current implementation of the method 'to_list'
all object instances are serialized regardless what
the variable 'iterable' is: None or [].

This patch allows to correctly handle such situations.
In case if the variable 'iterable' is None all object
instances are serialized, otherwise only selected from db.

Change-Id: I7b9913f364cfab085a8c94aec1435286a8e877f3
Closes-Bug: #1609290
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/87/352387/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if iterable is not None: use_iterable = iterable else: use_iterable = cls.all()

commit_message:
Check content type by completely match instead of partial match

Currently, 'get_content_type' method in neutron/wsgi.py checks
specified format by 'in' statement.
Thus, string(e.g. 'application/j') that is partial matched to
'application/json' is returned.

However, we cannot find valid serializer from the format,
and request fails with unexpected error.

Change-Id: I75aac0308d0fd0321973c4bda3bc07ca0224e1c1
Closes-Bug: #1612485
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/51/354551/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_content_type_with_partial_matched_string(self): request = wsgi.Request.blank('/tests/123') request.headers["Content-Type"] = "application/j" result = request.best_match_content_type() self.assertEqual("application/json", result)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-15 19:46:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance_store/commit/6a1436bd54316b6d46756638e34bd1bf5d5c5d8c', 'message': 'Drop None value for swift_store_config_file

While attempting to improve help text for configuration option
"swift_store_config_file", None is incorrectly listed as a
possible value. None is incorrect because a configuration option
can either be set or not. It can't be set to None. When no value
is set for a configuration option, it is inherently parsed as None
by oslo.config. Hence, there is no need to specify None as a
possible value.

Change-Id: If4fa246d642098e96093cb6be92b8cd9f4350268
Partial-Bug: #1570946
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-15 19:56:45.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/_drivers/swift/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance_store/commit/0ec9da6ce5e30848e6b060c98d91e072cbe4caf5', 'message': 'Fix help text of swift_store_config_file

While attempting to improve help text for configuration option
"swift_store_config_file", None is incorrectly listed as a
possible value. None is incorrect because a configuration option
can either be set or not. It can't be set to None. When no value
is set for a configuration option, it is inherently parsed as None
by oslo.config. Hence, there is no need to specify None as a
possible value.

Also, the configuration option swift_store_config_file is marked as
secret. Although the file pointed by this path can contain
credentials, the path itself need not be marked secret. This in fact
may make debugging harder if the file path is not logged clearly.

Change-Id: If4fa246d642098e96093cb6be92b8cd9f4350268
Partial-Bug: #1570946
'}]
commit_message:
Fix help text of swift_store_config_file

While attempting to improve help text for configuration option
"swift_store_config_file", None is incorrectly listed as a
possible value. None is incorrect because a configuration option
can either be set or not. It can't be set to None. When no value
is set for a configuration option, it is inherently parsed as None
by oslo.config. Hence, there is no need to specify None as a
possible value.

Also, the configuration option swift_store_config_file is marked as
secret. Although the file pointed by this path can contain
credentials, the path itself need not be marked secret. This in fact
may make debugging harder if the file path is not logged clearly.

Change-Id: If4fa246d642098e96093cb6be92b8cd9f4350268
Partial-Bug: #1570946

FwaaS v2 REST API

This patch adds the REST API definitions for the firewall v2 extension.

Co-Authored-By: Shweta P <shpadubi@cisco.com>
Partial-Implements: blueprint fwaas-api-2.0

commit_message:
Make server delete operation back compatible

The recent changes to server delete operation has added a 'force'
keyword argument for all cases. This is breaking out gate at rally.
This patch proposes adding a separate driver api so that the forced
delete is on a separate path.

Change-Id: I052e036a0d4dda210babb5623eb47a7bfe5f065b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/12/356212/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def server_delete(self, server, ignore_missing=True): ignore_missing=ignore_missing) @sdk.translate_exception def server_force_delete(self, server, ignore_missing=True): return self.conn.compute.delete_server(server, ignore_missing=ignore_missing, force=True)
deleted_lines: def server_delete(self, server, ignore_missing=True, force=False): ignore_missing, force)

commit_message:
Add tempest versioning test suite

This patch adds tempest tests for Murano Package versioning.
The next tests are provided:
1. Upload two packages which differ with only versions and
check their availability in artifact repository.
2. Deployment test of two packages in one environment, which
differ with only versions.
3. Deploy package with missed class by manifest version require.
4. Deploy package with available class by manifest version require.

Change-Id: I48fb1a1af475a99f3b7a6313338d2bbcfb95d579

commit_message:
Add weight in service_function_params when creating port pair.

  Weight in service function params are used to set the weight
   of the port pair in port pair groups in load balancing.
  Also add port pair group parameters when creating port pair
   group. Port pair group parameters are used to set properties
   of port pair group. Currently we only support lb_fields. lb_fields
   is used to decide which package headers are used to do load balancing.
  Also add chain_id support in port chain. If chain_id is not given,
   we will also assign one.
  Also add auto assign group_id in port pair group.

Change-Id: I4b53f8bdb7cf1b869d242d6f3a62f1059c984366
Closes-Bug: #1588463

commit_message:
Align hiera keys with service names

These hiera keys aren't aligned with the service names, which
will be required for composable generation of the ip lists
per service.

Change-Id: I423b544df174254ac511b906b0c570e701678022
Depends-On: I7febf28bf409e25e8e5961ab551b6d56bb11e0c6
Partially-Implements: blueprint custom-roles

commit_message:
Defaults empty hash to kernel_modules and sysctl_settings

Set empty hash by default to kernel_modules and sysctl_settings so catalog
won't fail if the parameters are not set in Hiera.

Change-Id: I24ab535b01e2724af457d39c03cd990c574ef0aa

Allow to run functional tests

This change allows to run functional tests adding gate_hook.sh and
post_test_hook.sh scripts.

Partial-Bug: #1560003

commit_message:
Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: I25c6d9fe0c50fd117a432ce6ca9a31e104503ffc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-dynamic-routing refs/changes/46/353146/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[AMQP 1.0] small fixes to improve timer scalability

This patch introduces the following tweaks to the timer
implementation:

Reduce the number of timers that need to be tracked by reducing the
timer granularity to units of seconds.

Decrease the default timeout values to further reduce the total number
of tracked timers.

Batch multiple expiring events that share the same deadline.

Inline the timer comparison code in the main event loop.

Avoid using an expensive comparison method in the heap sort by using
an integer primitive instead.

Use monotonic time instead of time.time()

Change-Id: I83e86bf203e6a641085e482c7ccf0e01f4fb4d86
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/90/349290/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Set use_stderr to False for all services

oslo.log has a setting to log to stderr as well as a log file and
defaults it to True. This causes OpenStack Ansible to log each service's
logs twice: once to /var/log/{{ service }}/{{ binary-name }}.log and
once to /var/log/upstart/{{ binary-name }}.log because upstart views
each log event on stderr as a priority. Defaulting this to False means
we reduce the duplication of log events on each container and that the
upstart logs are actually informative rather than confusing.

Change-Id: I9d2b2ca74fa75b7ec38de4b6fe01fdf73af03fe2
Closes-bug: 1588051
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/07/356107/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Make identity v3 groups_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.

This patch makes identity v3 groups_client list APIs accept
filter param.

Also add doc string link.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I916f2edb8706ebe9eccc0a353353e055d851f39e

Available params: see http://developer.openstack.org/ api-ref/identity/v3/#list-groups """ url = 'groups' if params: url += '?%s' % urllib.urlencode(params) resp, body = self.get(url) def list_group_users(self, group_id, **params): """List users in group. Available params: see http://developer.openstack.org/ api-ref/identity/v3/#list-users-in-group """ url = 'groups/%s/users' % group_id if params: url += '?%s' % urllib.urlencode(params) resp, body = self.get(url)

commit_message:
Make identity v3 users_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.

This patch makes identity v3 users_client use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I8b4e2059a9a8d4be1df5aab1de8a4339e97679d2

commit_message:
Cleanup/standardize usage of tags

The numerous tags within the role have been condensed
to two tags: swift-install and swift-config

These tags have been chosen as they are namespaced
and cover the two major functions of the role.

Change-Id: I96c04e5d2e43e68ad5af3cc5c6035130a5650af0
Signed-off-by: alextricity25 <miguel.cantu@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Log missing clients as WARNING instead of ERROR

This will prevent tracebacks from being logged if every client is not
installed when the engine is started.

Change-Id: I53c90f98689070a0b18e49ca7988e4176a8987ac
Closes-Bug: #1597593

classes. The 'namevar' method doesn't require any information from the
