commit_message:
Add missing namevar method to openstack_config provider

openstack_config contains a method 'self.instances' that is required for
purging unmanaged resources that references a static namevar method that
is not defined in openstack_config and may not be provided by base
classes. The 'namevar' method doesn't require any information from the
derived class so a default implementation in the base provider type
suffices.

Closes-Bug: #1612009

Change-Id: If27152863b9df5a28bf45e23ca989019666a958c
(cherry picked from commit 72150f2202ad09d59efc343ca4a8b62627b979b2)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib refs/changes/35/355235/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def self.namevar(section_name, setting) "#{section_name}/#{setting}" end

commit_message:
Install required packages for get_url module

To prevent Ansible get_url module from generating SNI warnings
several system packages are being installed so that system python
will allow us to get pip and install it.

This is a manual backport of:
 - https://review.openstack.org/354475
 - https://review.openstack.org/355420

Change-Id: I45e3eff716dba4fb2926794bc25bfb079bb328bf
Closes-Bug: 1612377

subject: Improve performance of recordsets API
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-13 01:57:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/10cc5c4da1f81e1f175fa9fb6a7ed9b1b0d0c379', 'message': 'WIP: Improve performance of recordsets API

The performance of /v2/recordsets API was found slow when
filtering on large amount of recordsets. The patch proposes
the following ways to improve the performance,
and was tested with 1M recordsets.

1. To explicitly mention a correct table index in sql queries
for different sort keys and filtering keys.
We found mysql optimizer is not able to choose the most suitable index;

2. Not showing total_count in the response of /v2/recordsets API
as the query to get the count contributes to almost half of the delay
and there is not an easy way to optimize.

DB migration
Change-Id: I7f3a09ce2c7396ff6ad02d3b5d562d186f66ed30
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-15 18:11:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/c1ca9d28bba125edacc30508707cff71b58e7d28', 'message': 'Improve performance of recordsets API

The performance of /v2/recordsets API was found slow when
filtering on large amount of recordsets. The patch proposes
the following ways to improve the performance,
and was tested with 1M recordsets.

1. To explicitly mention a correct table index in sql queries
for different sort keys and filtering keys.
We found mysql optimizer is not able to choose the most suitable index;

2. Not showing total_count in the case of all tenant requests
as the count query does not scale well on a large amount of records.

DB migration
Change-Id: I7f3a09ce2c7396ff6ad02d3b5d562d186f66ed30
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-24 22:14:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/38ef282b6c7c4a5e8e144157ddd51a0c000325e5', 'message': "Improve performance of recordsets API

The performance of /v2/recordsets API was found slow when
filtering on large amount of recordsets. The patch proposes
the following ways to improve the performance,
and was tested with 1M recordsets.

1. To explicitly mention a correct table index in sql queries
for different sort keys and filtering keys.
We found mysql optimizer is not able to choose the most suitable index;

2. Introduce a new header 'X-All-Projects-Count' to give operators
the flexibility of showing total_count or not, because we found that
the count query does not scale well on a large amount of records.

commit_message:
Improve performance of recordsets API

The performance of /v2/recordsets API was found slow when
filtering on large amount of recordsets. The patch proposes
the following ways to improve the performance,
and was tested with 1M recordsets.

1. To explicitly mention a correct table index in sql queries
for different sort keys and filtering keys.
We found mysql optimizer is not able to choose the most suitable index;

2. Introduce a new header 'OpenStack-DNS-Hide-Counts' to give operators
the flexibility of showing total_count or not, because we found that
the count query does not scale well on a large amount of records.

Performance results are at: https://gist.github.com/jamesyli/2eb9fb474a493477a9beb42fe122180f

DB migration
Change-Id: I7f3a09ce2c7396ff6ad02d3b5d562d186f66ed30

This adds python packages required for SNI support to ensure that tox
installs the packages into the venv when running tests.

commit_message:
Refactoring security group config options

Refactoring neutron security grp config opts to be in
neutron/conf/agent so that all the configuration options
reside in a centralized location. This simplifies the
process of looking up the config opts and provides an
easy way to import.

Change-Id: Ia9538f41dfd894ed55c1db1556b37aad09ad2ae1
Partial-Bug: #1563069

commit_message:
Configuration of certificate verification for HTTP dispatcher

verify_ssl can be set to:
True to use system-installed certificates (default value)
False to ignore certificate verification (use in development only!)
verify_ssl can also be set to the location of a certificate file
 e.g. /some/path/cert.crt (use for self-signed certs)
or to a directory of certificates.

Remove n-net related gates

Since devstack have switched to a neutron by default
we can keep only neutron gates in check list.

commit_message:
Allow health check to be enabled/disabled

This patch adds two RPC methods that allow the health checking on a
cluster to be dynamically enabled/disabled.

Change-Id: Ib591090985f413b8ba062bfe38a38c6db037d339
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/90/355790/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix health manager initialization

With this patch we postpone health manager initialization until service
records are cleaned up. Also, we change the executor to 'threading'
which is recommended by oslo.messaging. A new INFO log is added for
debugging's purpose.

Closes-Bug: #1613552
Change-Id: I761b61ee164fe3532aaaaad5408b68df84d0d7ca

commit_message:
modify main function

In main function sys.exit will exit python interpreter when it has
exception. Now we can call  the main() as below to avoid to exit the
interactive interpreter and specify the return value of main() in exit code.

Change-Id: I9c5014eb5e9807067f0df604ddb47d5908ffae21
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/16/349216/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return 130 return 1 sys.exit(main())

Add nova server groups plugin

This patch adds nova server groups plugin for serchlight.

Implements: blueprint nova-server-groups-plugin

Change-Id: I8198bbc6fd8cb7a06a353cf22c800ae1eeec548f

commit_message:
Disabled IPv6 privacy extensions

The IPv6 privacy extensions can cause issues by perfering a private network
over a pulbic which may limit connectivity in certain situations. An example
of a connectivity issue can be seen by trusty images not being able to
run a traceroute6 to "git.openstack.org". To resolve this issue the RFC3041
extensions have been disabled by default.

Change-Id: Ifcedc69597a61c350cba8247baa01541aa38c9f5
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/96/356196/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This will disable the disable Privacy extensions for IPv6 (RFC3041) # Neither of these settings are fatal if they fail, we'll simply # assume IPv6 is disabled on the node. if ! grep -q '^net.ipv6.conf.default.use_tempaddr' /etc/sysctl.conf; then (sudo sysctl -w net.ipv6.conf.default.use_tempaddr=0 | tee -a /etc/sysctl.conf) || true else sed -i "s|^net.ipv6.conf.default.use_tempaddr.*|$(sudo sysctl -w net.ipv6.conf.default.use_tempaddr=0)|" /etc/sysctl.conf || true fi if ! grep -q '^net.ipv6.conf.all.use_tempaddr' /etc/sysctl.conf; then (sudo sysctl -w net.ipv6.conf.all.use_tempaddr=0 | tee -a /etc/sysctl.conf) || true else sed -i "s|^net.ipv6.conf.all.use_tempaddr.*|$(sudo sysctl -w net.ipv6.conf.all.use_tempaddr=0)|" /etc/sysctl.conf || true fi
